item.title: Initial NES / 6502 Dev Machine Setup
item.description: I looked for lists online of tools I’ll need to build my Moon Lander game and found the following from FRITZVD. Below is what I’ve got setup so far: VirtualBox VM w/ the minimal install of Ubuntu Mate (Mate is lightweight and runs well in a VM) Default gVim from apt My Vim setup from my kapp-vim repo The NESASM assembler, built from source. Gimp for making graphics. Although I think I’ll be just using white and black for the initial version.

item.title: A bit of 6502 Assembly
item.description: For some time I’ve been thinking about how fun it would be to build a copy of an old Moon Landing game. I recently discovered that there are tools for writing NES roms from 6502 assembly, C, and JavaScript. I’ve got an emulator running on a Raspberry Pi 2 with a SNES controller. I think it would be super fun to build and play a homemade game on it. To that end I’ve gone through Nick Morgan’s Easy 6502 Tutorial and it was a lot of fun.
